name: Donald Trump
description: 45th President of the United States, known for his business background and unorthodox approach to politics.

name: Emmanuel Macron
description: Current President of France, known for his centrist policies and efforts in international diplomacy and climate change.

name: Barack Obama
description: 44th President of the United States, notable for being the first African American to hold the office.

name: Hillary Clinton
description: Former U.S. Secretary of State, 2016 Democratic Presidential nominee, and advocate for women's rights and healthcare reform.

name: Angela Merkel
description: Former Chancellor of Germany, known for her leadership during the Eurozone crisis and her open-door policy during the migrant crisis.

name: Vladimir Putin
description: Long-time Russian leader, serving as both President and Prime Minister, known for his influence over post-Soviet Russia.

name: Justin Trudeau
description: Current Prime Minister of Canada, known for his progressive policies on climate change, immigration, and social issues.

name: Theresa May
description: Former Prime Minister of the United Kingdom, primarily known for her role in leading the Brexit negotiations.

name: Narendra Modi
description: Current Prime Minister of India, known for his economic policies and initiatives in digitalization and infrastructure.

name: Shinzo Abe
description: Former Prime Minister of Japan, known for his economic strategy known as 'Abenomics' and efforts to revise Japan's pacifist constitution.

name: George Washington
description: First President of the United States, a Founding Father known for his leadership in the American Revolutionary War.

name: Winston Churchill
description: British Prime Minister during WWII, known for his leadership and oratory, playing a crucial role in defeating Nazism.

name: Mahatma Gandhi
description: Indian leader and key figure in the Indian independence movement against British rule, known for non-violent resistance.

name: Nelson Mandela
description: South African anti-apartheid revolutionary, first black President of South Africa, known for his role in ending apartheid.

name: Abraham Lincoln
description: 16th President of the United States, led the nation during the Civil War, known for emancipating slaves.

name: Franklin D. Roosevelt
description: 32nd President of the United States, led the country during the Great Depression and most of WWII.

name: Margaret Thatcher
description: First female Prime Minister of the UK, known for her conservative policies and strong-willed leadership.

name: John F. Kennedy
description: 35th President of the United States, known for his charismatic leadership and the Cuban Missile Crisis.

name: Julius Caesar
description: Roman general and statesman, played a critical role in the rise of the Roman Empire.

name: Elizabeth I
description: Queen of England during a time of great economic and cultural growth, known as the Elizabethan Era.

name: Theodore Roosevelt
description: 26th President of the United States, known for his progressive policies and conservation efforts.

name: Mao Zedong
description: Founding father of the People's Republic of China, known for his role in the Chinese Communist revolution.

name: Napoleon Bonaparte
description: French military leader who rose to prominence during the French Revolution and led several successful campaigns.

name: Ronald Reagan
description: 40th President of the United States, known for Reaganomics and ending the Cold War.

name: Deng Xiaoping
description: Chinese revolutionary and statesman, led China towards market economy reforms and opening up.

name: Charles de Gaulle
description: French general and statesman, led the Free French Forces during WWII and founded the French Fifth Republic.

name: Indira Gandhi
description: First and only female Prime Minister of India, known for her political ruthlessness and centralization of power.

name: Otto von Bismarck
description: German statesman who unified Germany, known as the Iron Chancellor for his leadership and diplomacy.

name: Benjamin Franklin
description: One of the Founding Fathers of the United States, known for his diplomatic roles and scientific contributions.

name: Queen Victoria
description: British monarch whose reign, the Victorian Era, saw the expansion of the British Empire and industrial revolution.

name: Simon Bolivar
description: Venezuelan military and political leader who played a key role in Latin America's successful struggle for independence.

name: Cleopatra
description: The last active ruler of the Ptolemaic Kingdom of Egypt, known for her political acumen and alliances with Roman leaders.

name: Alexander the Great
description: King of Macedonia who created one of the largest empires of the ancient world by the age of thirty.

name: Emperor Qin Shi Huang
description: First Emperor of China, known for unifying China and initiating construction of the Great Wall.

name: Genghis Khan
description: Founder of the Mongol Empire, which became the largest contiguous empire in history after his death.

name: Elizabeth II
description: Current Queen of the United Kingdom and other Commonwealth realms, known for her long and stable reign.

name: Louis XIV
description: King of France, known as the Sun King, his reign was the longest of any monarch in European history.

name: Mustafa Kemal Atat√ºrk
description: Founder and first President of Turkey, known for his extensive reforms in modernizing Turkey.

name: Joe Biden
description: 46th President of the United States, known for his long tenure in politics and focus on domestic and international diplomacy.

name: Boris Johnson
description: Current Prime Minister of the UK, known for leading the country through Brexit and his charismatic personality.

name: Moon Jae-in
description: President of South Korea, known for his efforts in inter-Korean peace and advocacy for human rights.

name: Mohammed bin Salman
description: Crown Prince of Saudi Arabia, known for his efforts in modernizing the kingdom and economic reforms.

name: Kim Jong-un
description: Supreme Leader of North Korea, known for his country's nuclear program, continuing the dynastic leadership established by his predecessors.
